result.execSummary:
The defendant Rita Denise Arms was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Any other sentence; If revoked: Huber release privileges for work and Day Reporting Center (DRC) ONLY

miscConds.notes:
Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges by 01-26-17. Any remaining balance will be immediately or an entry of a civil judgment shall be imposed.
- Restitution is set at $0 (zero).

- Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- Obtain/maintain full time employment or school if treatment allows.

timeConds.notes: This time to be given 33 days TIME SERVED

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant sentenced to serve 3 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 33 (thirty-three) days time served. COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months: If revoked: Huber release privileges for work and day reporting center (DRC) ONLY: 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
     *   As a condition of probation, the Court ordered
          the defendant to serve 33 (thirty-three) days
          in the House of Correction.  This time to be given
          the 33 (thirty-three) days time served.
     *   Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed
          medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.          
     *   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
          and successfully complete recommended treatment
          including random urine screens.
     *   Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
          treatment deemed appropriate.
     *   Obtain and maintain (full-time) employment or school 
          if treatment allows.
     *  Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges by January 26, 2017. 
          Any remaining balance will be due immediately or an entry
          of a civil judgment shall be imposed.
     *   Restitution is set at $0 (zero).
.

Defendant Rita Denise Arms in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Rita Denise Arms in custody.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Rita Denise Arms not in court, in custody and not produced.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Scheduling conference held off record.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 31.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

**DEFENDANT PREVIOUSLY POSTED $100.00.  BALANCE DUE IS $150.00.**
